33: "Who are you and what d'ye want?"
"That's @maam to you, youngster. Respect your elders!"
"That's better. Now, what did you want?"
"If I weren't, why would you be here?"
"Now stop this foolishness and tell me what you want, youngster."
"Oh, sure! Thou art just trying to get on my good side."
"Hmph! And not so much as a @thank-you."
"Well, that's kids today for ye! No manners, the lot of 'em!"
"Well, what can I do for thee?"
951: "What do you mean, heal? Thou art not wounded!"
1169: "What do you mean, heal? None of you are wounded!"
"Wilt thou make an offering of 30 gold?"
Laying hands upon $Y, Tobatha mends the wounds.
"Well, if thou wilt not pay, why should I heal thee?"
1610: "You youngsters think everything should be free!"
"Thou art not too bad, for a youngster."
Laying hands upon $Y, Tobatha mends the wounds.
1829: "What do you mean, cure? Thou art not poisoned!"
2048: "What do you mean, cure? None of you are poisoned!"
"Aye, $Y, I can tell that thou art poisoned."
"Wilt thou make an offering of 10 gold?"
Laying hands upon $Y, Tobatha removes the poison.
"Well if thou won't pay, thou won't get cured!"
2504: "You youngsters think everything should be free!"
"Thou art not too bad, for a youngster."
Laying hands upon $Y, Tobatha removes the poison.
2697: "Makin' mistakes and expecting their elders to bail them out."
"Wilt thou make an offering of 400 gold?"
"Then go see a gravedigger. I'll reckon his price'll be lower."
2986: "Go see a gravedigger. I'll reckon his price'll be lower."
Your party takes up a collection for their fallen comrade.
